title: How to Go Urban Exploring

steps.headline: Choose a place or area.
steps.description: This does not have to be urban and it does not have to be illegal or abandoned, either. You could start just outside your door or in the city centre, behind an empty house or in a residential area with blocks of flats. As urban areas are mostly the most complex, they are the most interesting, though.

steps.headline: Choose comfortable shoes.
steps.description: Nothing's worse than having to go home early because your feet hurt.

steps.headline: Pack your bag.
steps.description: Use a backpack, not a handbag. Take some food and drinks. Also take things you might need like a torch/lighter or money. (You might feel extra hungry or discover a nice shop.) Don't forget enough warm clothes if it is cold and sun lotion if the sun is shining.

steps.headline: Start walking.
steps.description: Try to go places you wouldn't normally go. Try doors to see if they're open. Go behind things, inside, on top or underneath.

steps.headline: Look out for interesting things like objects hanging or standing somewhere or lying on the floor, views, graffiti, stickers, secret doors, sculptures etc.
Don't forget to look upwards once in a while, wherever you are!
Follow the three rules of urban exploring:
steps.description: Take nothing but pictures. Leave nothing but footprints. Break nothing but silence.

text: Choose a place or area. This does not have to be urban and it does not have to be illegal or abandoned, either. You could start just outside your door or in the city centre, behind an empty house or in a residential area with blocks of flats. As urban areas are mostly the most complex, they are the most interesting, though. Choose comfortable shoes. Nothing's worse than having to go home early because your feet hurt. Pack your bag. Use a backpack, not a handbag. Take some food and drinks. Also take things you might need like a torch/lighter or money. (You might feel extra hungry or discover a nice shop.) Don't forget enough warm clothes if it is cold and sun lotion if the sun is shining. Start walking. Try to go places you wouldn't normally go. Try doors to see if they're open. Go behind things, inside, on top or underneath. Look out for interesting things like objects hanging or standing somewhere or lying on the floor, views, graffiti, stickers, secret doors, sculptures etc.  Don't forget to look upwards once in a while, wherever you are!  Follow the three rules of urban exploring: Take nothing but pictures. Leave nothing but footprints. Break nothing but silence.
